content:
Diagnosis:
Hurthle cell carcinoma of thyroid
T3N0M0 (AJCC 8th edition)

Previous treatment:
Total thyroidectomy - March 2024
Radioactive iodine 100mCi - April 2024

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

Current situation:
Post-treatment thyroglobulin 0.4 (previously 1.2)
TSH well suppressed at 0.1

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radioactive iodine therapy. The treatment was well tolerated with only mild short-term symptoms of dry mouth and slight nausea which have now resolved. The post-treatment whole body scan showed no evidence of residual disease or metastatic uptake. Thyroglobulin levels have appropriately decreased and TSH remains well suppressed on current levothyroxine dose.

Given the excellent response to treatment and current disease status, we will now transition to surveillance phase. I have explained that this will involve regular thyroglobulin monitoring and neck ultrasound, with the first scan scheduled for 6 months' time. We have discussed the importance of maintaining TSH suppression and continuing regular levothyroxine. [redacted name] understands to contact us if any new symptoms develop, particularly any neck symptoms or unexplained bone pain.

Plan for 3-monthly thyroglobulin measurements and clinic review in 6 months with ultrasound scan results.

cancer_timeline.value: Thyroglobulin decreased to 0.4 from 1.2, TSH well suppressed at 0.1
Post-treatment whole body scan showed no evidence of residual disease or metastatic uptake

patient_facts.value: Previous symptoms of dry mouth and slight nausea now resolved
TSH well suppressed at 0.1 on levothyroxine 125mcg daily

status_updates.value: Thyroid cancer post thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine. Excellent treatment response with no evidence of residual disease
Good biochemical response with falling thyroglobulin, no evidence of residual disease on whole body scan
Transitioning from active treatment to surveillance phase
3-monthly thyroglobulin measurements and neck ultrasound in 6 months
Clinic review in 6 months with ultrasound results
